comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: I suggest a different aproach. Using enum attributes to indicate if it can be a Person and if it can be an Organisation. Please see https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/javaOO/enum.html and search for the planets example.

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: If we go on with the previous approach, we can rename the methods and remove the duplicated code. Everything is clear that way.

comments.author: ReportsUser
comments.comment: Personally I wouldn't start this solution and leave it in the middle as the code wont support a true,true but we are giving the oportunity for that. Or finish the refactor supporting it or throwing an exeception saying UnSupported when true true or false false

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Dont use returns(Object), is has been removed in later JMockit versions:
Removed the returns(Object) method (deprecated in version 1.29 - see below) from the Expectations class.
Just use this result = whatever;
returns() is for when there is more than one invocation expected
Update all occurrences in this test class

comments.author: Conor Hogan
comments.comment: Should be "The absence start date is before the previous eligibility start date. The eligibility will be run for this new Leave Request" use before rather than prior?

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Replcae "prior than" with "before"

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Indicate that null can never be returned

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Method name is not great. OfLeaveRequest is not really needed, since we can see that it accepts a leave request. Its so similar (in both name and function) to getEligibilityStartDate that its very unclear of the significance of one vs the other.
For example, what would happen if I called getEligibilityStartDateOfLeaveRequest() and used the DateTime, ignoring the Boolean. Would that be equivalent to calling getEligibilityStartDate() since they both take the same parameters?
In my opinion, these two methods need rework/renaming/re-javadocing as they are consfusing.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Why assign to null? Make it final and remove null assignment

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: I think this should be moved to the javadoc of the method, as this is important for the caller to know, without having to open the method implementation. Once that is in the method javadoc, we dont need it here.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Order is incorrect, FAB-3420-bos must run before FAB-5399-bos (as in 8.4).
FAB-3420-bos - adds TGroupDisabilityClaimDTO FAB-5399-bos - modifies TGroupDisabilityClaimDTO
Hence order is important. Apply change to the 3 DBs
